extendedIngredients.name: cream cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 4 ounces cream cheese, cut into 1/2-inch pieces, room temperature
extendedIngredients.originalName: cream cheese, cut into 1/2-inch pieces, room temperature

extendedIngredients.originalName: package smoked trout fillets, broken into 1/2-inch pieces

title: Creamy Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Trout and Green Onions
summary: Creamy Scrambled Eggs with Smoked Trout and Green Onions is a gluten free, primal, and pescatarian morn meal. This recipe makes 4 servings with 674 calories, 39g of protein, and 55g of fat each. For $3.36 per serving, this recipe covers 34% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. A mixture of green onions, trout fillets, green onions, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It is brought to you by Epicurious. With a spoonacular score of 68%, this dish is good. Try Cheesy Scrambled Eggs With Green Onions, Creamy Scrambled Eggs With Smoked Salmon, and Breakfast Braid with Ham, Mushrooms, Cheddar, Green Onions, and Scrambled Eggs for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Whisk eggs in large bowl to blend. Add trout, cream cheese, green onions, and chopped dill. Season lightly with salt and generously with pepper; stir to mix.                                                                Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture and stir slowly until eggs just hold together and are cooked through but still moist, about 4 minutes. Divide egg mixture among 4 plates. Garnish with dill sprigs, if desired, and serve.

steps.step: Whisk eggs in large bowl to blend.
Add trout, cream cheese, green onions, and chopped dill. Season lightly with salt and generously with pepper; stir to mix.
Melt butter in large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add egg mixture and stir slowly until eggs just hold together and are cooked through but still moist, about 4 minutes. Divide egg mixture among 4 plates.
Garnish with dill sprigs, if desired, and serve.
